result.execSummary:
All charges against Donald Mark Gray in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald Mark Gray is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Mark Gray

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Defendant Donald Mark Gray in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls the cases. State indicates that a resolution has been reached. Plea to 21CT41; 60 days in jail with 62 days credit, time served. $1,744.00 fine inclusive. 24 month revocation of driver's license, 24 month IID requirement, mandatory alcohol assessment. 22CM13 and 22TR167 will be dismissed. Defendant agrees with the state's recommendation but states there are 64 days sentence credit. 
Court adjourns to allow the defendant to look over the waiver of attorney form. 
11:13 AM Court recalls case.
Court reviews defendant's right to an attorney. Defendant waives his right to an attorney. The court accepts the waiver and finds that the waiver is knowingly and voluntarily made. 
Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 in 21CT41. Court accepts plea and finds that the defendant's plea was knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds the defendant guilty and judgment of conviction is entered. 22TR167 and 22CM13 are dismissed. 
State has no additional requests. Mr. Gray asks for 120 days to pay fines. 
Court orders 60 days in jail with 45 days credit, time served. $1,744.00 fine inclusive. Bail is applied and 120 days to pay. 24 month revocation of driver's license, 24 month IID requirement, and mandatory alcohol assessment.
Court reviews the defendant's right to appeal. Form to be given to the defendant.
Status conference on May 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.

01:28 PM Defendant Donald Mark Gray in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Donald Mark Gray in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney.   Not guilty plea(s) entered. States request on bail: $500 cash bond  No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. Defendant is on a DOC hold on a January 2021. State receites prior criminal history. Defendant does not have any bail to post.
Attorney Craker asserts there has been very little criminal history in the last 13 years.   Family and local ties and does have a great history of appearing at all Court hearings.
Court Orders $500 cash bail with conditions of   No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. Court will send text message reminder slip to the jail  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
